attributes.action: Abandon all plans to build an incinerator at Four Ashes Staffordshire
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The proposed incinerator planned to be built at Four Ashes Staffs must be scrapped
The plans are opposed by Stafford Borough council amongst others 
The plant will have a detrimental effect on local reuse and recycle initiatives now being operated.
The scheme must use 300000 tons of waste per annum for 25 years 
Think of the huge number of lorry journeys needed to achieve this added to the exhaust emission's from the plant itself not to mention Congestion and noise problems.
The perceived need for this plant is based on old data that in my opinion is no longer valid
The recycling rates in Staffordshire is rising so refuse levels is falling and should fall further
Compare this to our neighbours in Stoke on Trent who have no incentive to reduce waste levels as they need to feed their incinerator.
Given industries change in attitude to packaging this source of waste should also begin to fall (ASDA already recycles 65% of it waste and is committed to remove the remaining 35%)
The proposed cost of the incinerator would consume almost all of the councils budget and less recycling credits would mean even less thought going into local more environmentally friendly schemes
